comments.body: It should also flow slower, About the same pace as lava, And speed up should it be introduced to a heat source via something like fire or a hot biome. Perhaps even make it able to be fully melted into water should you heat the source block enough or even frozen into all the way into ice somehow. Having a liquid with properties we can control via red stone could have huge implications, Imagine having slush water item transport streams with adjustable speeds.
perhaps it would have to be that specific water to make basalt
I like that one
This would be so funny
Could be useful for this mob, but I don't really see any other uses for it. Perhaps they could add something like this in the debug screen.
It is Warden.

I wouldn't have a copper boat, but since they are adding Boats with Chests, Boats with Furnaces could also be added. I think Steamboats would be really cool as you could just change direction and it would send you there. Not only could they be faster, if waves are added they could help you get past them
Emerald geode would be OP if it grew at the same rate as Amethyst. Perhaps it grows ten times slower?
emerald geodes dont exsist
394084842952 is right.
There actually used to be a feature like this in the early days of Minecraft. Why it was removed I don't know, but I'd love to see it return!

This is beacause mountain tops are lacking realism I think one of the problems is that you can see the biomes below the mountains instead if you are in a dense fog and witha dark sky you can't know your height or exactly were you are this would therefore add incentive to use the spyglass to wach a bit more arond you.
I think it would just be cool if it always snows at a certain height. So if you build really high your builds would start accumulating snow

IF these are able to hold nonstackables, I think it should go up to 3, but 5 at max, that would give us a reason to carry it lategame for assorted tools, such as a bundle with shears, flint& steel, and a bucket I also like the idea of adding more capacity for stuff that stacks up to 16, although I don’t want my inventory full of bundles because it’s the most efficient way to carry tools, and I don’t want to be able to die with a “valuables” bundle either, shulkers gave their place for mass storage

I agree. I never waste my wooden tools when I craft stone ones. I carry them around and once I have a reason to, burn them in the furnace. The tools take up too much space in my inventory, and it's pretty disappointing that the bundles are not going to help me with this issue.

I personally think that the bundles should be able to hold 64 items regardless of that item's stack size. Meaning that every item will take up one slot in the bundle. That way if you're looting multiple structures that give lots of armor/tools/weapons/etc, you'll only need a couple bundles for everything.
This makes sense.
It should not make a zipping noise because it does not have zippers. Still, it would be cool to have a sound
It would be useful if you could join a bow/crossbow with a telescope in the crafting table, and create a scoped bow/crossbow to have better accuracy when shooting.
The goat horn could also highlight other entities like the bell during raids

We dont need copper tools.
No one will use it. So why add it ?
No it should be below iron, maybe make it as strong as stone but more durable, you can even get a achievement (bronze age) for making it. Possibly even a weaker shield with copper look.
390132418191 Iron is incredibly easy to get, and even diamonds aren't that tough to find. We don't need any tiers lower than iron.
Copper is actually weaker than iron. So it wouldn't make sense for it stronger in this instance
The Hopewell mound builders had copper tools and armor. Why shouldn't we have the same in Minecraft?
I find copper ore plentiful much more so than iron yet it has no equal utility as iron does.
If they go with this, they should just make rabbits spawn more often in every biome (but still rarer than other animals) and drop more hide.
Another related idea: instead of making it cheaper, you start the game with one bundle. Mix and match as you see fit!
I think it should be 3 leather and 1 string, in a 2x2 grid.
We now have spyglass, bows and cross bows. But we also need scoped bow and cross bows. Please just a crafting recipe with bow/crossbow with spyglass. Please add it

Yea but let's say you got into a 1v1 fight and your dogs are near by, so you call the horn to summon all your dogs to attack which will be a unfair fight for the other player.

So it will be better if you have to stay still and be in a open area like at least 3x3 to able to use the horn and call your tamed wolves.
I like everything except the deal with the raids, that might make raids too easy...
Yes i meant that illagers aren't as mighty as players and it would make sense if they want you on their side. Why should you not be able to choose? They could hunt for you in return.

you schould sell it to villager for rare stuff

that would be nice
Don't sell it, it is aesthetically PERFECT for building. (you COULD sell it, though, if you were that kind of person...)
your right, that you can make special blok from it or customize some bloks. by the first poste id mean to trade for objects.
i hope this idea does not go unseen as it;s very good
This could be awesome! Semi-rare ores, maybe a different kind of cave fish or bioluminescent creatures, even spider eyes and glow ink!!

Perhaps even a new type of village?

One far more rare than the current ones. Where everything looks better, the villagers there there have better clothes and fancy trades. What you have is a good idea.

Master rank villagers want rubies for some extra trades. These trades would yield enchanted gear, and maybe even a choice of (or maybe just random) enchantment or a choice of what gear? Also, the wandering trader will trade high-level trades for rubies (maybe even nether and end trades, though those would be somewhat suspicious)
It needs more uses, it seems like a tier 2 emerald right now.

I also want Ruby Ore, HOWEVER, its main use should NOT be trading. Its wasted potential and that's why they won't add it if its just another random useless ore. It needs to have its own unique functions.

Idea for a unique drop: An ingredient for a luck potion, since those can't yet be obtained in survival, and the lurker would be an uncommon find in a very specific height range.

The ingredient itself could be relating to ore, like some diamond dust for example - something unobtainable otherwise, yet makes sense for a "miner turned undead" to have. (And since luck would be obtained from being underground, maybe have it also stack with fortune (and maybe looting) on top of fishing)

Of course, this is just one possibility. Since miners (or just the underground in general) have valuable items like gems, this seemed fitting.

Idea for unique attack: as you called it a lurker a shucker poped in my mind so why not give it a bit of shulker aspect it has tiny bug look texture here and there and accaiognly it fire a odd looking shulker bullet or lurker bullet which gives you blindness and levitation and that way we can have more mystery to the caves figure out how it got there in the first place? Is the lurker from the end or is the shulker the bug which crawls on the lurker?
Thats Great!
also goat milk with a bucket (probably the same milk u get in game with cows)
Yes but what would they look like later
Mojan should add goat cheese
Ещё сделаете чтобы горные козы давали козье молоко.
Pots could store honey and milk.
I feel like you could also put your tools in it just like the LEGO set!

Honestly when I read this I thought more of an aesthetic vibe. to be able to give your buildings and scenery a more fun touch by adding your items into pots. It also gave me the idea of what if we could see certain items more in a 3-D aspect like being placed. I feel like this would be a really fun way to show off more of a creative side towards the building and decorating area of Minecraft
pls vote! please

I think I could have one for each biome, for example a rattlesnake in the desert (it would be nice to hear the chucalho) and another aquatic type for the swamp

they could drop some kind of item that could make a poison potion
احب ان تضاف حيوانات جديده
Would it function differently than gold or iron pressure plates?

An entire new furnace type just for smelting Deepslate (which rarely anybody needs to use, since you can easily get it with silk touch, and most people don't use it in regular builds anyway) is just a waste.

If it just worked exactly the same as a regular furnace, but was more Deepslate themed, that would be fine.

BUT, if it has to be different, it should smelt Stone, Bricks, Glass, and other misc. things faster than normal furnaces.
